p: To assess the quality of the orientation determination in the general case, additional analysis using exhaustive search of indistinguishable solutions over a range of all possible Euler angles was performed (described in details in Supplementary Note 4). That search revealed, that all measurement schemes with only on-axis channels applied to samples with cubic symmetry exhibit an ambiguity where two different orientations produce exactly the same intensity measurements. These two orientations have Euler angle ψ which differs by 180°. Adding off-axis measurement channels removes this ψ + 180° ambiguity.
